marketNews.title: Foreign Inflow Continues, IDX Approaches 8,000
marketNews.content:
IDX (IHSG) strengthened by 1.3% to 7,892.9 on Wednesday, 13 August, driven by continued foreign fund inflow of approximately 1.5 trillion rupiah. This marks net foreign inflow for three consecutive trading days on the IDX since the start of the week, including an inflow of 2.2 trillion rupiah on Tuesday (12 August) which was the highest daily inflow since 14 May 2025. Since the start of 2025, the IDX has recorded a net foreign outflow of 57.3 trillion rupiah as of Wednesday (13 August).

The arrival of foreign funds lifted the prices of blue-chip stocks since the start of the week, with BBRI up 10.3%, BMRI up 4.3%, BBCA up 7.5%, BBNI up 7.4%, ASII up 5.2% and TLKM up 14.3%. The foreign inflow and the blue-chip rally followed the price increase of the conglomerate group after the MSCI announcement on Friday (8 August), where DSSA and CUAN were added to the MSCI Indonesia Global Standard.

The rise of the above stocks brought the IDX close to the 8,000 level, in line with optimism expressed by IDX President Iman Rachman, who said that the IDX could break the 8,000 level on the 80th anniversary of the Republic of Indonesia.

Positive sentiment also comes from the global side as expectations of a Federal Reserve rate cut strengthen, following weak US labor data and US inflation data that are broadly in line with expectations, as well as the extension of the US-China trade negotiation timeline. As of Wednesday (13 August), the probability of a 25-basis-point rate cut at the September 2025 meeting stood at 96.2% according to the CME FedWatch Tool. Through the end of the year, the probability of a minimum 50-basis-point Fed cut is at 93.7%, slightly higher than a week earlier at 92.7%.

Foreign inflow into the Indonesian capital market started earlier in the sovereign bond market, reflected by a decline in the 10-year government bond yield to 6.406% today, down 0.175 percentage points month-to-date. The rupiah also appreciated to 16,195 per US dollar today, marking a 1.8% month-to-date strengthening.

Key Takeaway

We assess that the continuation of foreign inflow will depend partly on improvements in Indonesia’s economic fundamentals. In the short term, we see investors focusing on the potential acceleration of government spending in the second half of 2025. From a global perspective, investors need to monitor the impact of US tariff policies that began to be implemented in August 2025, given their potential influence on inflation and Fed policy direction.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics to Know
marketNews.content:
1. Minister of Village and Disadvantaged Region Development, Yandri Susanto, said on Wednesday (13 Aug) that the Merah Putih Village Cooperative, which experienced default, will receive support from village funds up to 30% of the village fund allocation per year. The village fund allocation varies per village, ranging from 400 million rupiah to 1.6 billion rupiah.

2. Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources recorded that realized investment in the energy and mineral resources sector during 1H25 grew 24.1% YoY to 13.9 billion USD or ~225.5 trillion rupiah, marking the highest realization in five years. Investment growth was driven by oil & gas (+28.8% YoY) and mining (+29.2% YoY). By sector, oil & gas contributed 58% of investment, followed by mining 22%, electricity 14%, and renewable energy (EBT) 6%. From the state revenue side, non-tax revenue of the ministry during 1H25 reached 138.8 trillion rupiah, equal to 54.5% of the 2025 target.

3. Director General of the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Eniya Listiani Dewi, said that the presidential regulation on accelerating waste-to-energy power plant development will eliminate the tipping-fee mechanism that local governments currently pay to plant operators per ton of waste processed. The new model will be licensing-based. Eniya added that Danantara could handle the selection of waste-to-energy project developers before licensing at the ministry. However, Danantara’s involvement is limited to projects processing at least 1,000 tons per day.

4. Vice Minister of Finance of China, Liao Min, said on Wednesday (13 Aug) that the Chinese government plans to offer loan-interest subsidies to households and businesses to reduce borrowing costs and stimulate consumption. This policy differs from the previous policy where the Chinese government required banks to offer cheap-interest loans. Previously, on Tuesday (12 Aug), the Chinese government announced it would offer a 1-percentage-point interest subsidy for enterprises in eight consumer-service sectors and for individual consumers.

5. The government on Tuesday (12 Aug) increased the number of airports with international status from 22 to 40 to boost tourism and economic growth in the era of President Prabowo Subianto. This reverses the policy of the previous administration under President Joko Widodo, which last year reduced the number of international airports to 17 to cut costs. Last year, the government said only five airports operated regular international flights, while the rest only served limited or no international routes.

tickerNews.title: GoTo reports adjusted EBITDA of Rp427 billion in 2Q25, leading to 1H25 adjusted EBITDA of Rp820 billion
tickerNews.content: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia reported adjusted EBITDA of 427 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (versus 1Q25: positive 393 billion rupiah, 2Q24: negative 64 billion rupiah), based on pro-forma financial results. This result brings 1H25 adjusted EBITDA to 820 billion rupiah (versus 1H24: negative 165 billion rupiah), in line with the 2025 guidance from management that targets a range of 1.4–1.6 trillion rupiah. At the bottom line, pro-forma net loss was recorded at 222 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (versus 1Q25: loss 276 billion rupiah, 2Q24: loss 954 billion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: Amman Mineral International founder sells 26 million shares at average price Rp8,828
tickerNews.content: Director of Amman Mineral International, Lal Naveen Chandra, sold 26 million AMMN shares at an average price of 8,828 rupiah per share on 7 August 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 229.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Lal Naveen Chandra’s direct ownership in AMMN decreased from 0.109% to 0.073%.

tickerNews.title: Madhani Talatah Nusantara sells ~2.6 billion DEWA shares at average price Rp208
tickerNews.content: Shareholder Darma Henwa, PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara, sold approximately 2.6 billion DEWA shares at an average price of 208 rupiah per share on 8 August 2025. The total transaction value reached about 548.9 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara’s direct ownership in DEWA fell from 19.58% to 13.09%.

tickerNews.title: Telkom Indonesia plans to add independent commissioner, to be discussed at AGM on 3 September 2025
tickerNews.content: Telkom Indonesia plans to change its board of directors, which will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Meeting on 3 September 2025. SVP Corporate Communication & Investor Relations of TLKM, Ahmad Reza, told Bloomberg Technoz that the company intends to add an independent commissioner position.

tickerNews.title: XLSmart Telecom appoints Sanjay Kumar Gordhan A. Vaghasia as new director
tickerNews.content: Shareholder XLSmart Telecom Sejahtera approved on Tuesday, 12 August 2025, the appointment of Sanjay Kumar Gordhan A. Vaghasia as a new director of the company. Sanjay joined XLSmart on 1 July 2025 as Chief Integration Officer. Previously, Sanjay served as Chief Integration Officer at Indosat (ISAT) from 2021 to 2024.
